member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectAuthenticationStatusA
member.summary: true if response code A from issuer bank should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract.Response code A means that the 3DSecure service is unavailable and therefore a 3DSecure verification is not made.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectAuthenticationStatusU
member.summary: true if response code U from issuer bank should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract. Response code U means that it couldn't be determined if card was 3DSecure enrolled or not.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectCardNot3DSecureEnrolled
member.summary: true if cards not enrolled with 3D-secure should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectConsumerCards
member.summary: true if consumer cards should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectCorporateCards
member.summary: true if corporate cards should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectCreditCards
member.summary: true if credit cards should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.CreditCardOptions.RejectDebitCards
member.summary: true if debit cards should be declined; otherwise false. Default value is set on the contract.

member.summary: The amount (including VAT, if any) to charge the payer, entered in the lowest monetary unit of the selected currency.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.Class
member.summary: The classification of the order item. Can be used for assigning the order item to a specific product category, such as MobilePhone. Note that class cannot contain spaces and must follow the regex pattern [\w-]*. Swedbank Pay may use this field for statistics.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.Description
member.summary: A 40 character length textual description of the purchase.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.DiscountDescription
member.summary: Human readable description of the possible discount.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.DiscountPrice
member.summary: If the order item is purchased at a discounted price this field should contain that price, including VAT.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.ImageUrl
member.summary: The URL to an image of the order item.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.ItemUrl
member.summary: The URL to a page that can display the purchased item, product or similar.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.Name
member.summary: The name of the order item.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.Quantity
member.summary: The 4 decimal precision quantity of order items being purchased.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.QuantityUnit
member.summary: The unit of the quantity, such as pcs, grams, or similar. This is a free-text field and is used for your own book keeping.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.Reference
member.summary: Your reference that identifies the order item.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.Type
member.summary: The type of the order item. is the amount you are charged with when you are paying with invoice. The amount can be defined in the field.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.UnitPrice
member.summary: The price per unit of order item, including VAT.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.VatAmount
member.summary: The payment’s VAT (Value Added Tax) amount, entered in the lowest monetary unit of the selected currency. The vatAmount entered will not affect the amount shown on the payment page, which only shows the total amount. This field is used to specify how much ofthe total amount the VAT will be. Set to 0 (zero) if there is no VAT amount charged.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IOrderItem.VatPercent
member.summary: The percent value of the VAT multiplied by 100, so 25% becomes 2500.

member.name: T:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo
member.summary: Identifies the merchant that initiated the payment.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo.OrderReference
member.summary: The order reference should reflect the order reference found in the merchant's systems.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo.PayeeId
member.summary: This is the unique id that identifies this payee (like merchant) set by PayEx.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo.PayeeName
member.summary: The name of the payee, usually the name of the merchant.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo.PayeeReference
member.summary: A unique reference, max 30 characters, set by the merchant system - this must be unique for each operation! NOTE://PayEx may send either the transaction number OR the payeeReference as a reference to the acquirer. This will be used in reconciliation and reporting back to PayEx and you. If PayEx sends the transaction number to the acquirer, then the payeeReference parameter may have the format of String(30). If PayEx sends the payeeRef to the acquirer, the parameter is limited to the format of String(12) AND all characters must be digits/numbers.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo.ProductCategory
member.summary: A product category or number sent in from the payee/merchant. This is not validated by PayEx, but will be passed through the payment process and may be used in the settlement process.9

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IPayeeInfo.Subsite
member.summary: The subsite field can be used to perform split settlement on the payment. The subsites must be resolved with PayEx reconciliation before being used.

member.summary: Resource to access the URLs used for a payment resource.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.CallbackUrl
member.summary: The URI to the API endpoint receiving POST requests on transaction activity related to the payment.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.CancelUrl
member.summary: The URI to redirect the payer to if the payment is canceled, either by the payer or by the merchant trough an abort request of the payment or paymentorder.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.CompleteUrl
member.summary: The URL that Swedbank Pay will redirect back to when the payer has completed his or her interactions with the payment. This does not indicate a successful payment, only that it has reached a final (complete) state. A GET request needs to be performed on the payment order to inspect it further.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.HostUrls
member.summary: The array of URIs valid for embedding of Swedbank Pay Hosted Views.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.LogoUrl
member.summary: The URL that will be used for showing the customer logo. Must be a picture with maximum 50px height and 400px width. Requires HTTPS.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.PaymentUrl
member.summary: With permission and activation on your contract, sending in a logoUrl will replace the Swedbank Pay logo with the logo sent in. If you do not send in a logoUrl, then no logo and no text is shown. Without permission or activation on your contract, sending in a logoUrl has no effect.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.IUrls.TermsOfServiceUrl
member.summary: The URI to the terms of service document the payer must accept in order to complete the payment. Note that this field is not required unless generateReferenceToken or generateRecurrenceToken is also submitted in the request. This is the Merchants, not the Swedbank Pay Terms of Service. HTTPS is a requirement.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Card.CardPaymentRecurDetails.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata can be used to store data associated to a payment that can be retrieved later by performing a GET on the payment. Swedbank Pay does not use or process metadata, it is only stored on the payment so it can be retrieved later alongside the payment. An example where metadata might be useful is when several internal systems are involved in the payment process and the payment creation is done in one system and post-purchases take place in another. In order to transmit data between these two internal systems, the data can be stored in metadata on the payment so the internal systems do not need to communicate with each other directly.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Invoice.IReversalTransaction.VatAmount
member.summary: The payment’s VAT (Value Added Tax) amount, entered in the lowest monetary unit of the selected currency. The vatAmount entered will not affect the amount shown on the payment page, which only shows the total amount. This field is used to specify how much of the total amount the VAT will be. Set to 0 (zero) if there is no VAT amount charged.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Invoice.IReversalTransaction.ReceiptReference
member.summary: The receiptReference is a reference from the merchant system. This reference is used as an invoice/receipt number.

member.name: T:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Invoice.ReversalTransaction
member.summary: Transactional details for reversing a invoice transaction.

member.name: M:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Invoice.ReversalTransaction.#ctor(SwedbankPay.Sdk.Amount,SwedbankPay.Sdk.Amount,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates a new using the provided parameters.
member.param: The to return to the payer.
The to return from the VAT amount.
A textual description of the reversal.

The payeeReference is the receipt/invoice number if receiptReference is not defined, which is a unique reference with max 50 characters set by the merchant system. This must be unique for each operation and must follow the regex pattern [\w-]*.
The receiptReference is a reference from the merchant system. This reference is used as an invoice/receipt number.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.IPaymentInstrument.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata can be used to store data associated to a payment that can be retrieved later by performing a GET on the payment. Swedbank Pay does not use or process metadata, it is only stored on the payment so it can be retrieved later alongside the payment. An example where metadata might be useful is when several internal systems are involved in the payment process and the payment creation is done in one system and post-purchases take place in another. In order to transmit data between these two internal systems, the data can be stored in metadata on the payment so the internal systems do not need to communicate with each other directly.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Swish.SwishPaymentRequestDetails.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata can be used to store data associated to a payment that can be retrieved later by performing a GET on the payment. Swedbank Pay does not use or process metadata, it is only stored on the payment so it can be retrieved later alongside the payment. An example where metadata might be useful is when several internal systems are involved in the payment process and the payment creation is done in one system and post-purchases take place in another. In order to transmit data between these two internal systems, the data can be stored in metadata on the payment so the internal systems do not need to communicate with each other directly.

member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentInstruments.Trustly.TrustlyPaymentDetails.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata can be used to store data associated to a payment that can be retrieved later by performing a GET on the payment. Swedbank Pay does not use or process metadata, it is only stored on the payment so it can be retrieved later alongside the payment. An example where metadata might be useful is when several internal systems are involved in the payment process and the payment creation is done in one system and post-purchases take place in another. In order to transmit data between these two internal systems, the data can be stored in metadata on the payment so the internal systems do not need to communicate with each other directly.

Swedbank Pay does not use or process metadata, it is only stored on the payment so it can be retrieved later alongside the payment. An example where metadata might be useful is when several internal systems are involved in the payment process and the payment creation is done in one system and post-purchases take place in another. member.name: P:SwedbankPay.Sdk.PaymentOrders.IPaymentOrder.Metadata
member.summary: Metadata can be used to store data associated to a payment order that can be retrieved later by performing a GET on the payment order. Swedbank Pay does not use or process metadata, it is only stored on the payment order so it can be retrieved later alongside the payment order. An example where metadata might be useful is when several internal systems are involved in the payment process and the payment creation is done in one system and post-purchases take place in another. In order to transmit data between these two internal systems, the data can be stored in metadata on the payment order so the internal systems do not need to communicate with each other directly.
